preface.p: This book is written to help students review physics. The book contains a review of main ideas and many solved exercises. Many physics concepts require Calculus for definition. The sections and problems that require Calculus have been marked so that a student who does not need that amount of detail can skip them.

Students can test their understanding quickly by attempting the Checkpoint exercises, embedded in the concept sections. Each chapter ends with bootcamp section, which is a collection of problems to further strengthen your ability.

This book should be helpful to anyone preparing for physics contests or medical admissions test or a student wanting a quick review. The presentation also encourages self-learners. May also be useful as a resource for students who are either in a Calculus-based or Algebra-based introductory physics survey course.
